hotspots.label: Spider Web Center
hotspots.fact: Spiders create webs from silk that they produce in their bodies. This silk is stronger than steel of the same thickness, making it one of nature's toughest materials!

hotspots.label: Radial Web Strands
hotspots.fact: The straight lines stretching from the center are called radial threads. Spiders use these like spokes on a wheel to support the entire web structure.

hotspots.label: Spiral Catching Threads
hotspots.fact: The curved lines you see form a spiral pattern that catches insects. These sticky threads trap prey, while the radial threads are not sticky so the spider can walk safely.

hotspots.label: Dew Drops on Web
hotspots.fact: The tiny beads of water on the web are morning dew. They help us see the web's intricate design and also attract insects to the sticky threads.
